com.stormpath.sdk.directory

Interface AccountCreationPolicy

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Resource, Saveable

    public interface AccountCreationPolicy
extends Resource, Saveable
    A AccountCreationPolicy resource is used to configure different aspects and actions relevant to the Account-creation process.
    Since:
    1.0.RC4.5

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ModeledEmailTemplateList getAccountVerificationEmailTemplates()
      Returns the ModeledEmailTemplateList collection that contains the 'verification email' templates that can be used for sending the ‘verification email’ when new accounts are created.
      UnmodeledEmailTemplateList getAccountVerificationSuccessEmailTemplates()
      Returns the UnmodeledEmailTemplateList collection that contains the ‘verification success email’ templates that can be used for sending the ‘verification success email’ for new accounts.
      EmailStatus getVerificationEmailStatus()
      Returns the Account Verification Email Status

      An disabled indicates that the Account verification Workflow is disabled.
      EmailStatus getVerificationSuccessEmailStatus()
      Returns the Account Verification Success Email Status An disabled indicates that the Account verification Success Workflow is disabled.
      EmailStatus getWelcomeEmailStatus()
      Returns the Welcome Email Status An disabled indicates that the Welcome Workflow is disabled.
      UnmodeledEmailTemplateList getWelcomeEmailTemplates()
      Returns the UnmodeledEmailTemplateList collection that contains the ‘welcome email’ templates that can be used for sending a 'welcome email' to a newly registered account.
      AccountCreationPolicy setVerificationEmailStatus(EmailStatus accountVerificationEmailStatus)
      Specifies whether the Account Verification Workflow is enabled or disabled for the parent directory.
      AccountCreationPolicy setVerificationSuccessEmailStatus(EmailStatus accountVerificationSuccessEmailStatus)
      Specifies whether the Account Verification Success Workflow is enabled or disabled for the parent directory.
      AccountCreationPolicy setWelcomeEmailStatus(EmailStatus welcomeEmailStatus)
      Specifies whether the Welcome Email Workflow is enabled or disabled for the parent directory.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.stormpath.sdk.resource.Resource

        getHref

      • Methods inherited from interface com.stormpath.sdk.resource.Saveable

        save

    • Method Detail

      • getAccountVerificationEmailTemplates

        ModeledEmailTemplateList getAccountVerificationEmailTemplates()
        Returns the ModeledEmailTemplateList collection that contains the 'verification email' templates that can be used for sending the ‘verification email’ when new accounts are created.
        Returns:
        the ModeledEmailTemplateList collection that contains the 'verification email' templates that can be used for sending the 'verification email' when new accounts are created.

      • getAccountVerificationSuccessEmailTemplates

        UnmodeledEmailTemplateList getAccountVerificationSuccessEmailTemplates()
        Returns the UnmodeledEmailTemplateList collection that contains the ‘verification success email’ templates that can be used for sending the ‘verification success email’ for new accounts.
        Returns:
        the UnmodeledEmailTemplateList collection that contains the ‘verification success email’ templates that can be used for sending the ‘verification success email’ for new accounts.

      • getWelcomeEmailTemplates

        UnmodeledEmailTemplateList getWelcomeEmailTemplates()
        Returns the UnmodeledEmailTemplateList collection that contains the ‘welcome email’ templates that can be used for sending a 'welcome email' to a newly registered account.
        Returns:
        the UnmodeledEmailTemplateList collection that contains the ‘welcome email’ templates that can be used for sending a 'welcome email' to a newly registered account.

      • getVerificationEmailStatus

        EmailStatus getVerificationEmailStatus()
        Returns the Account Verification Email Status

        An disabled indicates that the Account verification Workflow is disabled. Therefore, the account verification email will not be sent to the newly created account.

        Returns:
        the Account verification Email status.

      • setVerificationEmailStatus

        AccountCreationPolicy setVerificationEmailStatus(EmailStatus accountVerificationEmailStatus)
        Specifies whether the Account Verification Workflow is enabled or disabled for the parent directory. When disabled, the account verification email will not be sent to a newly created account.
        Parameters:
        accountVerificationEmailStatus - the status of the Account Verification Email Workflow
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • getVerificationSuccessEmailStatus

        EmailStatus getVerificationSuccessEmailStatus()
        Returns the Account Verification Success Email Status An disabled indicates that the Account verification Success Workflow is disabled. Therefore, the account verification success email will not be sent when the email for a newly created account is successfully verified.
        Returns:
        the Account verification Success Email status.

      • setVerificationSuccessEmailStatus

        AccountCreationPolicy setVerificationSuccessEmailStatus(EmailStatus accountVerificationSuccessEmailStatus)
        Specifies whether the Account Verification Success Workflow is enabled or disabled for the parent directory. When disabled, the account verification email will not be sent when the email for a newly created account is successfully verified.
        Parameters:
        accountVerificationSuccessEmailStatus - the status of the Account Verification Success Email Workflow
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • getWelcomeEmailStatus

        EmailStatus getWelcomeEmailStatus()
        Returns the Welcome Email Status An disabled indicates that the Welcome Workflow is disabled. Therefore, a welcome email will not be sent when a new account is created.
        Returns:
        the Account verification Success Email status.

      • setWelcomeEmailStatus

        AccountCreationPolicy setWelcomeEmailStatus(EmailStatus welcomeEmailStatus)
        Specifies whether the Welcome Email Workflow is enabled or disabled for the parent directory. When disabled, the welcome email will not be sent for a newly created account.
        Parameters:
        welcomeEmailStatus - the status of the Welcome Email Workflow
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.
